citation.article-title: Pyrococcus furiosus sp. nov. represents a novel genus of marine heterotrophic archaebacteria growing optimally at 100 C

p.s: Description of Pyrococcus gen. nov., Stetter and Fiala
Pyrococcus (Py.ro.coc'cus Gr. neutr, n. pyr fire; Gr. masc. n. coccos berry; M. L. masc. n. Pyrococcus the fireball)
Slightly irregular cells, 0.8 -2.5 μm in width, monopolar polytrichous flagellated.
Growth between 70 and 103°C (opt.: 100°C pH 5-9 and 0.5-5% NaCl.
Shortest doubling time about 37 rain under optimal conditions.
Heterotrophic growth on peptone, tryptone, yeast extract, meat extract, extracts of eu- and archaebacterial cells, casein, maltose, starch and casamino acids.
Formation of H2 and CO2 from yeast extract and peptone.
Sulfur is only required for growth at high hydrogen concentrations.
In the presence of sulfur, H2S is formed in addition.
ADP-ribosylation of elongation factor 2 by diphtheria toxin.
Isopranyl ether lipids in the cell membrane. 38 mol% GC.
